it.unibo.alchemist.boundary.interfaces

Interface OutputMonitor<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type which describes the concentration of a molecule
    All Superinterfaces:
    Serializable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    GraphicalOutputMonitor<T>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Abstract2DDisplay, AbstractNodeInspector, Continuous2DDisplay, EnvironmentInspector, EnvironmentSampler, Generic2DDisplay, MapDisplay, NodeInspector, NodeTracker, NumberOfNodesNextToANode, PositionSampler, SAPERENearestNodeSampler, SAPERENodeInspector, TimeStepMonitor

    public interface OutputMonitor<T>
extends Serializable

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void finished(IEnvironment<T> env, ITime time, long step)
      This method will be called by the simulation once the whole simulation has finished, either because it reached its latest point or because the user stopped it.
      void initialized(IEnvironment<T> env)
      This method will be called by the simulation as soon as the initialization phase is completed.
      void stepDone(IEnvironment<T> env, IReaction<T> r, ITime time, long step)
      This method will be called by the simulation every time a simulation step is done.

    • Method Detail

      • finished

        void finished(IEnvironment<T> env,
              ITime time,
              long step)
        This method will be called by the simulation once the whole simulation has finished, either because it reached its latest point or because the user stopped it. Thread safety note: no specific policy is defined for the control flow which will execute this method. A new thread could have been spawned or the same flow of the simulation may execute this method. This depends on the specific ISimulation implementation.
        Parameters:
        env - The current environment
        time - The time at which the simulation ended
        step - The last step number

      • initialized

        void initialized(IEnvironment<T> env)
        This method will be called by the simulation as soon as the initialization phase is completed. Thread safety note: no specific policy is defined for the control flow which will execute this method. A new thread could have been spawned or the same flow of the simulation may execute this method. This depends on the specific ISimulation implementation.
        Parameters:
        env - the environment

      • stepDone

        void stepDone(IEnvironment<T> env,
              IReaction<T> r,
              ITime time,
              long step)
        This method will be called by the simulation every time a simulation step is done. Thread safety note: no specific policy is defined for the control flow which will execute this method. A new thread could have been spawned or the same flow of the simulation may execute this method. This depends on the specific ISimulation implementation.
        Parameters:
        env - The current environment
        r - The last reaction executed
        time - The time at this simulation point
        step - The current simulation step
